description:
This protocol outlines the Bray-Curtis dissimilarity NMDS ordination and significance analysis of our manuscript. Here we will look at the clustering of the virome samples using our reference independent OTU table based on contig hits. We will compare skin environments (sebaceous, etc), occlusion status, and time. We also look at the difference between the background controls and the rest of the samples. Based on the methods from the following publication:

Hannigan, Geoffrey D., et al. "The Human Skin Double-Stranded DNA Virome: Topographical and Temporal Diversity, Genetic Enrichment, and Dynamic Associations with the Host Microbiome." mBio 6.5 (2015): e01578-15.
protocol_affiliation: DEPARTMENT OF DERMATOLOGY UNIVERSITY OF PENNSYLVANIA

collections.protocol_name: The Human Skin dsDNA Virome: Topographical and Temporal Diversity, Genetic Enrichment, and its Dynamic Associations with the Host Microbiome
collections.protocol_name_html: The Human Skin dsDNA Virome: Topographical and Temporal Diversity, Genetic Enrichment, and its Dynamic Associations with the Host Microbiome

authors: HANNIGAN GD, GRICE EA, ET AL.

source_data.description: Load the required R packages.

source_data.name:
library(vegan)
packageVersion("vegan")

library(ggplot2)
packageVersion("ggplot2")


library(scatterplot3d)
packageVersion("scatterplot3d")

library(reshape2)
packageVersion("reshape2")

library(plyr)
packageVersion("plyr")

library(pgirmess)
packageVersion("pgirmess")

source_data.description: Import OTU table.

source_data.name: INPUT <- read.delim("../../IntermediateOutput/Bray-curtis_virome_analysis/contig_otu_table_transposed_formatted.txt", header=TRUE, sep="\t")

components.data: Remove last column because it contains NAs (due to transposing Python script upstream).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove last column because it contains NAs (due to transposing Python script upstream).

source_data.name: INPUT_NO_FINAL <- INPUT[ ,c(1:74361)]

source_data.description: Import mapping file.

source_data.name: INPUT_MAP <- read.delim("../../IntermediateOutput/Mapping_files/SkinMet_and_Virome_001_metadata.tsv", header=TRUE)

components.data: Here we need to reformat the mapping files. This means only looking at the two time points for which we have a complete data set (we have only partial data for time point 1), as well as excluding the sites and subjects for which we only have partial sampling (as mentioned in previous notebooks).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Here we need to reformat the mapping files. This means only looking at the two time points for which we have a complete data set (we have only partial data for time point 1), as well as excluding the sites and subjects for which we only have partial sampling (as mentioned in previous notebooks).

components.data: We will be generating NMDS plots to visualize the distances between virome samples based on site environment, occlusion status, and time point. We also calculate the significance using the adonis test which was stratified across subjects.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: We will be generating NMDS plots to visualize the distances between virome samples based on site environment, occlusion status, and time point. We also calculate the significance using the adonis test which was stratified across subjects.

components.data: Generate subset of mapping file for only the specific anatomic sites and all time pints (2 and 3). Remove rows in mapping file with ID of NA (meaning the mapping row belongs only to the metagenome dataset).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Generate subset of mapping file for only the specific anatomic sites and all time pints (2 and 3). Remove rows in mapping file with ID of NA (meaning the mapping row belongs only to the metagenome dataset).

source_data.name:
SUBSET_MAP <- INPUT_MAP[-which(INPUT_MAP$NexteraXT_Virome_SampleID %in% NA), ]
SUBSET_MAP <- SUBSET_MAP[which(SUBSET_MAP$TimePoint %in% c(2,3)), ]
SUBSET_MAP <- SUBSET_MAP[-which(SUBSET_MAP$Site_Symbol %in% c("Ba","Ph","Vf","Neg")), ]
SUBSET_MAP <- SUBSET_MAP[-which(SUBSET_MAP$SubjectID %in% c(2,3,9,11)), ]
SUBSET_MAP <- SUBSET_MAP[c(order(SUBSET_MAP$NexteraXT_Virome_SampleID)),]

components.data: Get only the samples described in the map subset.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Get only the samples described in the map subset.

source_data.name:
KEEP_SAMPLES <- as.vector(SUBSET_MAP$NexteraXT_Virome_SampleID)
INPUT_SUBSET <- INPUT_NO_FINAL[which(INPUT_NO_FINAL$ContigID %in% c(KEEP_SAMPLES)), ]
row.names(INPUT_SUBSET) <- INPUT_SUBSET[,1]
INPUT_SUB_FORMAT <- INPUT_SUBSET[,-1]
head(INPUT_SUB_FORMAT)[,c(1:5)]

components.data: Generate distance matrix using Bray Curtis for all time point (2 and 3).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Generate distance matrix using Bray Curtis for all time point (2 and 3).

source_data.name: INPUT_SUBSET_DIST_MATRIX <- vegdist(INPUT_SUB_FORMAT, method = "bray")

components.data: Visualize the distance matrix using NMDS.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Visualize the distance matrix using NMDS.

source_data.name: BRAY_ORD_NMDS <- metaMDS(INPUT_SUBSET_DIST_MATRIX,k=3)

source_data.description: Record the stress value.

source_data.name:
BRAY_ORD_FIT = data.frame(MDS1 = BRAY_ORD_NMDS$points[,1], MDS2 = BRAY_ORD_NMDS$points[,2], MDS3 = BRAY_ORD_NMDS$points[,3])

BRAY_ORD_NMDS$stress

components.data: Generate and visualize merged NMDS and MAP data.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Generate and visualize merged NMDS and MAP data.

source_data.name:
BRAY_ORD_FIT$SampleID <- rownames(BRAY_ORD_FIT)
NMDS_AND_MAP <- merge(BRAY_ORD_FIT, SUBSET_MAP, by.x="SampleID", by.y="NexteraXT_Virome_SampleID")
head(NMDS_AND_MAP)[,c(1:5)]

source_data.description: Start plotting the figures.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 13 of Script R6: Virome Beta Diversity
source_data.annotation: The legends will show up on top of the figures here, but running the first plot without the second legend line will generate the plot alone (this is what was used in publication)
source_data.thread_text: The legends will show up on top of the figures here, but running the first plot without the second legend line will generate the plot alone (this is what was used in publication)

source_data.body: The legends will show up on top of the figures here, but running the first plot without the second legend line will generate the plot alone (this is what was used in publication)

source_data.name:
s3d <- scatterplot3d(NMDS_AND_MAP$MDS1,NMDS_AND_MAP$MDS2,NMDS_AND_MAP$MDS3, pch=16, color=as.integer(factor(NMDS_AND_MAP$Site_Categories)), type="h")
legend('right', pch = 16,legend = levels(factor(NMDS_AND_MAP$Site_Categories)),  col = seq_along(levels(NMDS_AND_MAP$Site_Categories)), inset=c(0.1,0))

adonis(INPUT_SUBSET_DIST_MATRIX ~ factor(NMDS_AND_MAP$Site_Categories), perm=999, strata = factor(NMDS_AND_MAP$SubjectID))

components.data:
##
## Call:
## adonis(formula = INPUT_SUBSET_DIST_MATRIX ~ factor(NMDS_AND_MAP$Site_Categories), permutations = 999, strata = factor(NMDS_AND_MAP$SubjectID))
##
## Blocks: strata
## Permutation: free ## Number of permutations: 999
##
## Terms added sequentially (first to last)
##
  Df   SumsOfSqs   MeansSqs   F.Model
factor(NMDS_AND_MAP$Site_Categories) 2   2.562   1.28109   5.0118
Residuals 249   63.649   0.25562    
Total 251   66.211        
               

## Residuals
## Total
## ---
## Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
components.name: Expected result

components.name: Description

components.data: Environmental background contol in the analysis Generate subset of mapping file for only the specific anatomic sites and all time points (2 and 3).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Environmental background contol in the analysis Generate subset of mapping file for only the specific anatomic sites and all time points (2 and 3).

source_data.name:
SUBSET_MAP <- INPUT_MAP[-which(INPUT_MAP$NexteraXT_Virome_SampleID %in% 
    NA), ]
SUBSET_MAP <- SUBSET_MAP[which(SUBSET_MAP$TimePoint %in% c(2, 
    3)), ]
SUBSET_MAP <- SUBSET_MAP[-which(SUBSET_MAP$Site_Symbol %in% c("Ba", 
    "Ph", "Vf")), ]
SUBSET_MAP <- SUBSET_MAP[-which(SUBSET_MAP$SubjectID %in% c(2, 
    3, 9, 11)), ]
SUBSET_MAP <- SUBSET_MAP[c(order(SUBSET_MAP$NexteraXT_Virome_SampleID)), 
    ]

INPUT_SUBSET <- INPUT_NO_FINAL[which(INPUT_NO_FINAL$ContigID %in% 
    c(KEEP_SAMPLES)), ]
row.names(INPUT_SUBSET) <- INPUT_SUBSET[, 1]
INPUT_SUB_FORMAT <- INPUT_SUBSET[, -1]

source_data.description: Record the stress value.

source_data.name:
BRAY_ORD_FIT = data.frame(MDS1 = BRAY_ORD_NMDS$points[, 1], MDS2 = BRAY_ORD_NMDS$points[, 
    2])

BRAY_ORD_NMDS$stress

source_data.description: Plot MDS1 vs MDS2.

source_data.name:
RAY_ORD_FIT$SampleID <- rownames(BRAY_ORD_FIT)
NMDS_AND_MAP <- merge(BRAY_ORD_FIT, SUBSET_MAP, by.x = "SampleID", 
    by.y = "NexteraXT_Virome_SampleID")
ggplot(NMDS_AND_MAP, aes(x = MDS1, y = MDS2, size = 6, group = CNTRL, 
    colour = CNTRL)) + theme_bw() + geom_point()

components.data: Calculate the significance of the differences between the environmental background and the rest of the samples.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Calculate the significance of the differences between the environmental background and the rest of the samples.

source_data.name:
adonis(INPUT_SUBSET_DIST_MATRIX ~ factor(NMDS_AND_MAP$CNTRL), 
    perm = 999, strata = factor(NMDS_AND_MAP$SubjectID))

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 28 of Script R6: Virome Beta Diversity
source_data.annotation: From here we would calculate the mean across the various sites and merge in the mapping file data but we are going to want to use this file here for distance matrix calculations.
source_data.thread_text: From here we would calculate the mean across the various sites and merge in the mapping file data but we are going to want to use this file here for distance matrix calculations.
source_data.body: From here we would calculate the mean across the various sites and merge in the mapping file data but we are going to want to use this file here for distance matrix calculations.

components.data: Convert the file to wide format so that it can be used for distance matrix calculations.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Convert the file to wide format so that it can be used for distance matrix calculations.

source_data.name: inputWide <- dcast(INPUT_SUBSET, V1 ~ V3, value.var = "V2")

components.data: I pulled out a couple values to ensure the transformation was correct.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: I pulled out a couple values to ensure the transformation was correct.

source_data.name:
inputWideTranspose <- as.data.frame(t(inputWide[, -1]))
INPUT_SUBSET_DIST_MATRIX <- vegdist(inputWideTranspose, method = "bray")

components.data: Visualize the distance matrix using NMDS.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Visualize the distance matrix using NMDS.

source_data.description: Plot the data.

source_data.name:
BRAY_ORD_FIT = data.frame(MDS1 = BRAY_ORD_NMDS$points[, 1], MDS2 = BRAY_ORD_NMDS$points[, 
    2], MDS3 = BRAY_ORD_NMDS$points[, 3])
BRAY_ORD_NMDS_STRESS <- BRAY_ORD_NMDS$stress
NMDS_AND_MAP <- merge(BRAY_ORD_FIT, SUBSET_MAP, by.x = "row.names", 
    by.y = "NexteraXT_Virome_SampleID")
s3d <- scatterplot3d(NMDS_AND_MAP$MDS1, NMDS_AND_MAP$MDS2, NMDS_AND_MAP$MDS3, 
    pch = 16, color = as.integer(factor(NMDS_AND_MAP$Site_Categories)), 
    type = "h")
legend("right", pch = 16, legend = levels(factor(NMDS_AND_MAP$Site_Categories)), 
    col = seq_along(levels(NMDS_AND_MAP$Site_Categories)), inset = c(0.1, 
        0))

source_data.description: Test the significance.

source_data.name:
adonis(INPUT_SUBSET_DIST_MATRIX ~ factor(NMDS_AND_MAP$Site_Categories), 
    perm = 999, strata = factor(NMDS_AND_MAP$SubjectID))

components.data:
##
## Call:
## adonis(formula = INPUT_SUBSET_DIST_MATRIX ~ factor(NMDS_AND_MAP$Site_Categories), permutations = 999, strata = factor(NMDS_AND_MAP$SubjectID))
##
## Blocks: strata
## Permutation: free ## Number of permutations: 999
##
## Terms added sequentially (first to last)
##
  Df   SumsOfSqs   MeansSqs   F.Model
factor(NMDS_AND_MAP$Site_Categories) 2   0.6099   0.304959   3.8099
Residuals 249   19.9311   0.080045    
Total 251   20.5410        
               

## Residuals
## Total
## ---
## Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

source_data.description: Also plot occlusion.

source_data.name:
s3d <- scatterplot3d(NMDS_AND_MAP$MDS1, NMDS_AND_MAP$MDS2, NMDS_AND_MAP$MDS3, 
    pch = 16, color = as.integer(factor(NMDS_AND_MAP$Occlusion)), 
    type = "h")
legend("right", pch = 16, legend = levels(factor(NMDS_AND_MAP$Occlusion)), 
    col = seq_along(levels(NMDS_AND_MAP$Occlusion)), inset = c(0.1, 
        0))

source_data.description: Test the significance.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 35 of Script R6: Virome Beta Diversity
source_data.annotation: There is a significant difference between the sites, even when using the taxonomic profiles, suggests that even though the annotated portion of the data only represents a small portion of the community, it is actually able to detect the large trends for the overall community.
source_data.thread_text: There is a significant difference between the sites, even when using the taxonomic profiles, suggests that even though the annotated portion of the data only represents a small portion of the community, it is actually able to detect the large trends for the overall community.
source_data.body: There is a significant difference between the sites, even when using the taxonomic profiles, suggests that even though the annotated portion of the data only represents a small portion of the community, it is actually able to detect the large trends for the overall community.

    perm = 999, strata = factor(NMDS_AND_MAP$SubjectID))

components.data: Also look at the alpha diversity.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Also look at the alpha diversity.

source_data.name:
shannonDiv <- as.data.frame(diversity(inputWideTranspose, index = "shannon"))
colnames(shannonDiv) <- c("shannonDiv")
alphaAndMap <- merge(shannonDiv, SUBSET_MAP, by.x = "row.names", 
    by.y = "NexteraXT_Virome_SampleID")
MicroEnvPlot <- ggplot(alphaAndMap, aes(x = Site_Categories, 
    y = shannonDiv)) + theme_classic() + geom_boxplot(notch = TRUE)
MicroEnvPlot

components.data: Check for significance of differences between the groups. Check levels of categories.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Check for significance of differences between the groups. Check levels of categories.

source_data.name:
alphaAndMap$Site_Categories <- factor(alphaAndMap$Site_Categories)
levels(alphaAndMap$Site_Categories)

source_data.description: Run Kruskal-Wallis on the dataset.

source_data.name: kruskalmc(alphaAndMap$shannonDiv, alphaAndMap$Site_Categories)

components.data:
## Multiple comparison test after Kruskal-Wallis
## p.value: 0.05
## Comparisons
##   obs.dif   critical.dif   difference
## Intermittently_Moist-Moist   25.987989   28.54913   FALSE
Intermittently_Moist-Sebaceous   8.339718   28.43069   FALSE
Moist-Sebaceous   17.648271   25.32023   FALSE
components.name: Expected result

source_data.result:

source_data.description: Also look at occlusion status.

source_data.name:
OcclusionPlot <- ggplot(alphaAndMap, aes(x = Occlusion, y = shannonDiv)) + 
    theme_classic() + geom_boxplot(notch = TRUE)
OcclusionPlot
